page.title: 07WALROW HOUSING AND PONDS
page.content: ON EACH SIDE OF THE B3139,BURNHAM-ON SEA TO WELLS ROAD,ARE THE OLD VICTORIAN BRICK BUILT TERRACE HOUSES BUILT TO ROUSE THE WORKERS AT THE THEN BUSY RAILWAY WORKS AND THE NOW EXTRACT BRICK WORKS. BUILT TO HOUSE FAMILIES OF FIVE AND MORE,THE BUILDINGS ARE STILL IN A GOOD STATE. PEOPLE WHO LIVE IN THEM HAVE ADDED MODERN HEATING SYSTEMS AND HAVE HOMES OF WHICH THEY ARE PROUD. AT LEAST ONE, STILL HAS A PIGEON LOFT IN ITS GARDEN. A HOBBY ONCE VERY STRONG IN THE AREA. BEHIND THE NORTH TERRACES,THE OLD CLAY PITS HAVE BEEN UTILSED.ONE ROW ENHANCES A SMALL BUNGALOW ESTATE WHICH THE LARGER PONDS HAVE BEEN STOCKED WITH FISH FOR THE PLEASURE OF LOCAL FISHERMEN.
